summary: A character reference letter written by Anne Holve, Ghislaine Maxwell's eldest sister, to Judge Alison J. Nathan in support of Maxwell's bail request. The letter attests to Maxwell's character, family background, and innocence, and argues she would not flee if released on bail.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the bail request and character reference. Her sister describes her upbringing, character, and asserts her innocence of the charges she faces.

persons.name: Anne Holve
persons.context: The author of the letter and Ghislaine Maxwell's eldest sister. She provides a personal character reference, describes their family upbringing, and expresses shock at the charges.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over Ghislaine Maxwell's case to whom the character reference letter is addressed.

persons.name: Michael Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as the late eldest Maxwell sibling who died after a car accident in 1961.

connections.description: Anne Holve is Ghislaine Maxwell's eldest sister, has known her since birth, and is providing a character reference for her.

events.title: Death of Michael Maxwell
events.description: The eldest Maxwell sibling, Michael, died after a car accident.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on unspecified charges, which her sister expresses shock about.

events.title: Scheduled Court Date
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is determined to fight the charges in court in July 2021.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
Oxford (city, implied as family home location)
North London (location of Anne Holve's therapy practice)
keyFacts: Anne Holve, Ghislaine Maxwell's eldest sister, provides a detailed personal character reference asserting Maxwell's innocence and moral character.
The letter describes a difficult upbringing under a domineering father but emphasizes the family's work ethic and moral values.
Holve states she never witnessed Ghislaine be violent or sexually inappropriate with anyone.
The letter argues Maxwell would not flee if granted bail and is determined to fight the charges in court.
The document is part of the formal legal proceedings for Maxwell's bail request, addressed to Judge Alison J. Nathan.
